casebody.data:
H.G. DAVIS, Appellant, v. Johnny Wayne CARTER, Judge, one and all; Faulkner County Quorum Court, one and all; H.G. Foster, Prosecuting Atty., one and all; Marty Montgomery, originally sued as Monty Montgomery, Appellees. No. 06-3467. United States Court of Appeals, Eighth Circuit. Submitted: Sept. 21, 2007. Filed: Oct. 4, 2007. H.G. Davis, Conway, AR, pro se. Michael R. Rainwater, J. Stephen Holt, Jeremy Michael Cliffor McNabb, Rainwater & Holt, Mark Lunsford Pryor, Attorney General’s Office, Melanie Winslow Hoover, Arkansas Attorney General’s Office, Little Rock, AR, for Appellees.

Before BYE, RILEY, and MELLOY, Circuit Judges.

[UNPUBLISHED]

PER CURIAM.

H.G. Davis appeals the district court’s1 order denying his motion to set aside judgment in his 42 U.S.C. § 1983 lawsuit. We find no abuse of discretion in the district court’s dismissal of his postjudgment motion as untimely. See Middleton v. McDonald, 388 F.3d 614, 616 (8th Cir.2004) (standard of review). Accordingly, we affirm. See 8th Cir. R. 47B.

. The Honorable William R. Wilson, Jr., United States District Judge for the Eastern District of Arkansas.
